muito bom, viciante, jogabilidade muito boa.
Mas tem seus porens, existem killers campers, uso de hack, nao tem servidor dedicado (o que dificulta muito salas decentes), quando reportamos jogadores nao vejo nenhuma atitude.
Fica chato jogar assim, uma coisa é poder jogar, outra é ficar no gancho o tempo todo com o killer parado na sua frente.
Contudo eu recomendo muito e vou continuar jogando, só espero que os caras considerem puniçoes para esses jogadores ruins.

J'ai commencé à jouer il y a 3ans. Après environ presque 2000h voilà se que j'en panse.
Dead by Daylight et plutôt excellent, c'est un jeu amusant, souvent frustrant. Un principe simple, des personnages et des défis intéressants. Cependant, il y a quand même pas mal de bugs. Le jeu s'apprécie mieux quand il est partagé entre amis. Mais Bon outre les bugs et les joueurs Toxic se jeu et une vrai addiction.

Très bon jeu avec des amis, moin en solo. Il est meilleur de jouer avec ses amis en survivant mais si vous jouez en solo il est préférable de jouer tueur. Beaucoup de nouveaux tueurs arrivent sur le jeu comme Freddy Krueger( Les griffes de la nuit)  Michael Myers (Halloween) ou encore Amanda (saw)  en ce début d'année. J'aime beaucoup retrouver les tueurs comme Leatherface (Massacre à la tronçonneuse), Michael Myers (Halloween), ainsi que les deux autres précédents venant eux aussi de films d'horreur assez connus.
Pour en venir au gameplay : 
Points Positifs :
-Une bonne ambiance tout au long de la partie.
-Amélioration des personnages.
-Une lampe torche ou des palettes qui sont les seuls moyens de ce défendre, car oui et heureusement, les survivants n'ont pas d'armes blanches ou d'armes à feu, ils ne peuvent donc pas rivalisé contre le tueur, le seul moyen est de fuir. (ou troll en faisant des 360 ou autres choses mais après c'est vous qui voyez)
Points Négatifs:
-Le jeu est rué de bugs (Le personnage qui ce tp parfois, la barre d'action qui disparaît lorsque l'on soigne quelqu'un, etc...)
-La connection en jeu dépend de la connection du tueur qui souvent lag. ( Après nous pouvons très bien quitter et rejoindre un autre salon mais à force cela devient lassant)

Voilà tout ce que j'ai à dire sur le jeu, je n'ai pas tout cité, mais je reviendrais quelques fois pour enrichir mon évaluation.

The latest version I played was 5.3.2 (2,214.1 hours on record)

To make it short: I highly advise to not support these developers unless they finally fix the issues many players are complaining about for years. I would really like to see these developers to run out of money so that they finally hand over Dead by Daylight to actually competent developers. To summarise the average impression of the developers: High incompetence, low interest in the community and greedy for money. There are so many issues that I can't even list them here. It seems they designed DbD to allow player to harass and insult everyone they want without any consequences.

ARCHIVE [ TOME / RIFT ]
Challenges can be selected to unlock points, backgroundstories and progress in the Rift to unlock cosmetics. Without a 10$ Pass you can only unlock about 20 cosmetics. About 45 cosmetics are locked behind the Pass including the 10$ in ingame currency which you can only fully get back if you reach level 69 of the 70 levels in the rift which takes a lot of time. With the Pass you also unlock the ability to invest more money to buy levels.

AIMASSIST
There is actually an aimassist for the killer in DBD. It doesn't always work and if it works I may work in various ways. The aimassist may target a different survivor than originally aimed for, may cause the killer to run into an object beacsue the aim assist makes the character move directly towards the survivor even with an object between or makes the attack hit a survivor that would have managed to evade the attack. 

BAN/-CONDITION
Maybe the best examples for the developer incompetence are banconditions. Playing really unfair and toxic seems to be no reason to be banned, which is the way the developers support toxic players. Instead players are likely to get banned, when the developers screw up a mechanic/perk/etc. again even when there was no problem for many patches and a player is getting WITHOUT realizing an advantage. Players searching for bugs or trying to reproduce them in PRIVATE and UNRANKED matches are also at risk if they are just fooling around with some bugs/glitches no matter if the do so to contribute to bug reports. Based on what I have read and seen they just push the fault to their customers instead of improving themself.

BUGS
Way to many bugs and glitches. Less than in the past but still far to many. With 5.0.0 a new map was released and was basically immediately removed from the matchmaking.

COLLISION/HITBOXES
The hitboxes in DBD are larger than the actually characters. Only very few times an attack visually connects as there may be still a meter distancebetween weapon tip and the survivor but the hit still counts. These hitboxes combined with the broiken collsion detections results in further frustration. Many times already I have noticed players getting hit only because the got stuck.

COMMUNITY
The community turns more and more toxic with the support of the developers which appear to not care the slightest.

DEVELOPERS
From my point of view the developers don't care to get DBD finally balanced and mostly free of bugs. DBD was released more than three years ago. It still seems to be an alpha version. If they would have announced what DBD would become I would have requested refunds immediatly. Every time a new patch is released new issues are present as well. The amount of issues fixed may be equivalent to the amount of new ones. I personally intent to avoid every other game thses developers work on.

DLCs/ADD-ONs
There have been many new survivors and killers been added to the game. The licensed one much be purchased with money while original characters are either free or purchaseable ingame. To actually get all achivements players are forced to spent more money for new characters. It's not wrong to provide add-ons in general but with the lack of new gameplay and the many issues more content should be free.

EAC EASY-ANTI-CHEAT
DBD is using EAC which caused my trouble many timess already without using any cheat/hack. I had many game crashes where I lost items and had to deal with EAC error messages prevent my game from starting. Lagswitching is still working and isn't uncommen but EAC seems to not do something about that. In short: Trouble for those who just want to play fair.


INPUTLATENCY
Input latency hardly predictable so some times your inputs are resposive but the next match they may be delayed so that skillchecks (mini event where specific zones must be hit to prevent action regression and maybe getting a bonus) are getting unfair. Inputs may also be stored shortly. No longer pressing an action button may still let an action trigger unintentionally. Sprint through a window makes a noise and gives a notification to the killer. Sprinting to a window but vaulting slowing would be silent. It may more or less often happen that the sprint key is no longer pressed a fast vault is still triggered. 

MATCHMAKING/LATENCY
The current matchmaking still connects experienced and inexperienced players together resulting in very unfair situations that ruins the fun for both types of players. Leaving a lobby results in a five second cooldown before a new lobby can be opened or getting connected to a lobby. A lot of players leave because of a terrible ping (300 ms or more) and get punished by the result of developers deciding to not use servers but P2P. Servers were announced for Summer 2019 but the should have been in use a few years ago to avoid lagswitching or a lot of delay related situations. I expect the servers to be malfunctioning for weeks if not months. There are latency issues about every second match.

OFFERINGS
Offerings (items that may influence points, maps, starting positions) are used once the match loadingscreen starts instead of the real match start. Since many players crash during the loading screens a lot of offerings are lost. These items can be expensive ingame as well as being rare. Some killers like to dc just to let survivors loose their offernings.

SUPPORT
The support ignores most e-mails and the answers I revived were mostly insufficient. I asked several times for technical support as well as a few times for a statement related to the way issues are getting addressed/ignored and got absolutely ignored. With several other players I wrote a mail stating several concerns, bugs with media proofs, possible solutions to many issues players complain about for years and the clear intention to improve the game without any ill thought. Ignored without any response.

RANKING/EMBLEM SYSTEM
Survivors and killers have four different categories they get emblems for. As the killer the highest emblems are awarded when the killer prevents the survivors from repairing gens, keep chases short and sacrifice all survivors. As Survivor you get the best emblems for repairing generators/opening the exit gates, keeping all other survivors alive, don't get downed and stay hidden from the killer/escape from the killer. The last emblem about staying hidden is very unfair as the emblem requires an offensive playstyle instead of a defensive one. I already had a few times escaped without being seeing by the killer but I only got a bronze emblem (worst < best: No emblem, bronze silver, gold, iridescent). A certain value of emblems is needed to rank up.

VERDICT
While the main concept is still interesting this "developer" team seems to be highly unfit to actually use the potential. There are by far too many issues and only few matches are actually fun to play. I recommend to not buy it unless it's really fixed or wait for it to be f2p.

Each match is very fun, thrilling, and suspenseful. The fear of being jumpscared by a Myers appearing out of nowhere keeps you on high alert at all times. A bear trap might be lurking in that patch of grass, so watch your step. A near-invisible killer might surprise you, so watch out for the shimmers. The community? Well, throw away your seasonings 'cause you won't be needing salt anymore.

I've played for about 150 hours.  Each match lasts about 15-20 minutes so that's about 400-450 matches.

The game is awesome in most respects, but the only variation you get is really from killers.  Survivors have some interesting perks that change them up a little, but for the most part they're all the same.  One survivor might give you increased healing speed when healing others, one might have a faster crouch movement, but all in all the variation isn't much.  Picking your perks is what gives you a little variation, which can help you in interesting ways during the match, but isn't really enough to keep the game feeling fresh.

Killers on the other hand is mostly what makes the matches feel a little different, for a while.  One killer can lay traps, making them dangerous to you even when they're a good ways from you.  One killer can throw hatches to hit you from a distance, etc.  And most of the time you won't have any idea which killer you're facing until you're in the match and either see them or hear their special effects

The game is very fun, and jump scary when you're new b/c you're still being taken off guard, however it gets old repeating the same things over and over again.

What this game needs, more than new killers and new survivors... is new game modes and match types.  Every match is currently the same.  Map might look a little different each time because object placement on the map is randomized, but it's still the same map.  Your objective is also the exact same every match.  Repair a few generators which power the exit gates, open the gates, run out, don't die.

What might make the game fresh again is a new game mode where rather than repairing generators, you're piecing together clues spread around the map which give the survivors an ability to kill the killer.  The more survivors that survive and team up with all the clues, the more powerful they are, the fewer survivors that survive to find all the clues, the more difficult it is to kill the killer.  No exit gates.  Play till you kill the killer, or get killed.  Something like that.  Maybe a match with 2 killers under different rules, where not only are the killers trying to stop you, they have to fight and compete against each other too.  Like Jason vs Freddy.

A unique assymmetrical pvp game that has the depth of mobas like LoL or Dota but have lower match time, distinct teamwork requirement (survivor) or game sense (killer). The horror fades away as you get used to it, but rpg aspect is always there.  Killers are slightly underpowered, but the game is balanced fairly often.

~> Dead by Daylight é um jogo multiplayer 4x1(Quatro sobreviventes contra um assassino)
~> O objetivo dos sobreviventes é ligar 5 geradores de energia para assim abrir uma saída e fugir para assim ganhar a partida(Para vencer não precisa necessariamente que todos os sobreviventes fujam só basta um escapar para ganhar mas claro se todos fugirem melhor e mais pontos ganham)
~> Já o assassino tem que impedir os sobreviventes e tentar matar os quatros para assim ele vencer a partida
~> É otimo para se jogar com amigos mas se você não tiver amigos pode ficar tranquilo que mesmo assim ele é muito divertido
~> Muito dificil de ficar enjoado com esse jogo porque cada partida acontece algo(Em uma partida você é o sobrevivente e na outra o assassino)

I do enjoy the game , every round is a little bit different so it remains fun in most ways , although as of right now The Pig killer needs nerfed and sometimes a round won't load but aside from that you can't go wrong with this game as long as you have stable internet you can play. A lot of variety in killers and survivors , even in their clothes just don't be a camper if you get this game. -.- seriously

TLDR : Gameplay's great, community occaisonally sucks, but it's worth it!  9/10

Pros:
 - Character variety (Killers and survivors, both aesthetically and functionally)
 - Mostly well balanced (but when it's not, it's more horrory)
 - Fantastic tension buildup (surprisingly for killers as well as survivors)
 - Can make or break alliances as survivor
 - There's *always* loads of other players online
 - Can play LAN / LAN against unknown killer / against a LAN group / alongside a LAN group
 - Even an inexperienced player can beat a DLC-buying prestiger with good timing and play sense
 - Upgrading characters and sharing 'bloodpoints'
 - Simple to understand, difficult to master
 - Intuitive gameplay and interactions
 - No in-game chat and only two in-game interactions (point and beckon), but so much more can be said by how you interact personally. There is however, a before-and-after-game text chat
 - Active Dev group
 - Decent graphics
 - Haven't come across a single detrimental bug (sometimes the clothes physics go weird though)

Cons:
 - Toxic community (some people are just plain mean and there's no way to know who's had complaints against them)
 - Some of the DLC is OP e.g. Krueger (or maybe I'm a noob?)
 - Maybe just a little expensive, so I bought it on sale

IMPORTANT PS : Though there are players and groups who are unkind, there are plenty more who play fairly and just want an enjoyable horror experience. Those who act immaturely are easily ignored.

Overall I think the members of the community who complain about camping and call names are frustrating, but I love the game for how it plays and the friendly players, and it's easy to tell that lots of others do too - 9/10

Если вы любитель стиля Horror, а ещё вам нравится играть, то эта игра не оставит вас равнодушными. 
Игра Dead by Daylight захватывает в первую очередь своими локациями. Пусть не всегда они отвечают максимальной прорисовкой, но всё же масса карт сделана просто восхитительно. Одни из моих любимых локаций: Гнилое Болото (Бледная Роза) и Красный Лес (Обитель матери). Сам игровой процесс интересен своей неожиданностью. Даже зная карту на 100% вы не можете предугадать тактику игры противника. Первое время игры было даже не немного пугающе :), а первые часы после покупки игры периодически подскакивал от неожиданности происходящего :). В Dead by Daylight достаточное количество разносторонних персонажей для игрового процесса предоставленных после покупки игры. Но если вам захочется чего то более эксклюзивного, то вы можете приобрести дополнительные DLC так же предоставленные разработчиками (впрочем, я так и сделал :)). На днях мне прилетел страйк с обидой, что я кого то из игроков оставил висеть на крюке (хотя кажется, в этом раунде я принял такую же учесть :)). Не вижу смысла обиды в данной сложившейся ситуации. Ведь игровой процесс рекомендует играть командой, но не обязывает. Тут выбирать только вам: быть одиночкой или играть с командой, но не забывайте о том, что если вы плюнете на общество, то общество утрётся, а если общество ………:)
На мой взгляд, разработчики внимательно относятся к исправлению багов (я в этом не спец, но при каждом обновлении с интересом читаю перечень исправлений и изменений). Безусловно косяков в игре хватает, но всё же игра от этого не становится менее интересней . Так же приятно, что поддержка данной игры продолжает реализовываться и проект не заброшен на ранних стадиях.
В целом я думаю, что на момент написания данного мини обзора я отыграл достаточно мало (72 часа), что бы понять и увидеть все прелести игры.
P\S. Всё написанное ранее является выражение моего личного взгляда по игре Dead by Daylight и ни в коем случае не является рекламой игры или рекламой платного контента.
